key_insight: Applying a Nesterov-style momentum to ray-direction search (ARS-OPT) substantially speeds convergence, cutting the number of queries needed to find minimal ℓ2 hard‑label adversarial perturbations.
problem_solved: Hard‑label black‑box attacks require many queries because only top‑1 labels are returned; this work reduces query complexity by accelerating the optimization over ray directions that produce minimal perturbations.
method: Formulate hard‑label attack as searching for an optimal ray direction whose scaled ℓ2 perturbation first crosses the adversarial decision boundary.
Introduce ARS‑OPT: a momentum (Nesterov‑inspired) update on ray directions to accelerate convergence of the black‑box search.
Provide theoretical convergence-rate improvements and validate empirically to demonstrate large query savings versus prior ray‑search baselines.
impact: Significantly fewer queries make hard‑label attacks more practical for real‑world evaluation and stress‑testing of deployed models, and provide a stronger, more query‑efficient baseline for robustness research.
visual_elements: Geometry diagram: image, ray from original image, shortest ℓ2 perturbation point where ray intersects adversarial region, annotated with direction and magnitude.
Convergence plot: queries on x‑axis vs ℓ2 distortion (or success rate) on y‑axis comparing ARS‑OPT and baseline methods showing faster drop for ARS‑OPT.
Algorithm flowchart: iterative loop highlighting momentum (lookahead) step, query-based boundary search, and update of ray direction.
Bar/stacked chart: average query reduction (%) across datasets and models to summarize empirical gains.
paper_title: Improving the Convergence Rate of Ray Search Optimization for Query-Efficient Hard-Label Attacks
paper_authors: Xinjie Xu, Shuyu Cheng, Dongwei Xu, Qi Xuan, Chen Ma
